content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the final simplified passage

When responding to prompts, only respond to the given question and do not proceed to the next step

The passage:
The data used for training the system has been captured from the drone, by flying it in and around urban and semi-urban streets, by experts having at least 6-8 years of flying experience.
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity. Is determined complexity higher than DC (Average person)? Answer "Yes" or "No"

To determine if the text is at the desired complexity, I need to assess the current complexity of the passage. Based on the given text, the complexity is relatively high due to the presence of technical terms and specialized vocabulary. The current complexity is above the "Average person" DC. 

The algorithm will continue.

Identify a single complicated section of the passage. Remember to respect the ILT (Medium-High) contraint. Simplify this section. Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage. Only provide the reincorporated version

The identified complex parts are:
- "by experts having at least 6-8 years of flying experience" (this is a specific and technical detail)
- "urban and semi-urban streets" (this phrase implies a level of nuance and specificity)

The complexity of the identified parts is 8 and 7 respectively, which is higher than the Average person DC (5). 

Answer: Yes

Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original. Comparison must be between the originally provided (the very first) passage and the current simplified version. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences. What is the highest severity level identified in your last answer? Is it higher than ILT (Medium-High)? Provide the highest severity level, followed by an answer to the ILT question as "Yes" or "No"

Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.

The identified complex section is: "by experts having at least 6-8 years of flying experience." This section contains specialized vocabulary ("experts") and a numerical range ("6-8 years"), making it complex for the "Average person" DC.
Accept the proposed simplification. Print the updated version of the passage

The complicated section is: "by flying it in and around urban and semi-urban streets, by experts having at least 6-8 years of flying experience."

This section can be simplified to: "by experienced pilots in urban areas."

The simplified passage: The data used for training the system has been captured from the drone, by experienced pilots in urban areas.
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity. Is determined complexity higher than DC (Average person)? Answer "Yes" or "No"

Information loss and its severity: 
The original passage states that the data was captured by "experts having at least 6-8 years of flying experience", whereas the simplified passage states that it was captured by "experienced pilots in urban areas". The information loss is that the simplified version does not specify the level of experience or the expertise of the pilots, resulting in a severity of High. 

High is higher than ILT (Medium-High), so changes are rejected.
Print the final version of the simplified passage, include only the text of the passage with no comments or additional punctuation, and do not provide the original passage

The identified complex parts are:
- "The data used for training the system has been captured from the drone" (this is a formal and technical phrase)
- "urban areas" (this is a specific and somewhat nuanced term)

The complexity of the identified parts is 6 and 5 respectively, which is higher than the Average person DC (5). 

Answer: Yes
